revised_title: Compression Splitting and Fracture of Brittle Materials
tldr: This study investigates the compression failure of glassy brittle materials, focusing on three distinct failure modes: gross yielding under the compressing platen, compression splitting, and plastic instability (buckling). The authors propose a two-strut elastic model to explain the compression splitting failure mode, which is supported by finite element and boundary element calculations. The model helps to understand the role of pre-crack length and platen width in controlling the failure mode transition.
